questions.text: What is the default subnet mask for a Class C network?
questions.explanation: A Class C network uses 255.255.255.0 as its default subnet mask, providing 254 usable host addresses.

questions.text: Which cable type is used to connect a switch to a switch?
questions.explanation: A crossover cable is used to connect similar devices like switch-to-switch or router-to-router.

questions.text: What is the maximum transmission distance for 10GBASE-SR over multimode fiber?
questions.explanation: 10GBASE-SR supports up to 300 meters on OM3 multimode fiber.

questions.text: Which OSI layer is responsible for end-to-end communication?
questions.explanation: The Transport Layer (Layer 4) handles end-to-end communication and error recovery.

questions.text: What is the purpose of VLAN tagging?
questions.explanation: VLANs segment networks into separate broadcast domains, improving performance and security.
